column1: Strawberries were wild berries found in several regions of Middle-earth.
Bilbo Baggins tried to satisfy his hunger with wild strawberries growing near a stream in the upper Vales
column2: as Thorin and Company escaped the Goblin-town during early July.See User:Gamling/Hobbitdates

column1: During the last years of the Third Age
column2: strawberries were among the many fruits produced by The Shire
column3: and were enjoyed by the young Hobbits.

column1: J.R.R. Tolkiens adventure in Switzerland in 1911 was his inspiration for the journey from Rivendell to the other side of the Misty Mountains
column2: and it is quite possible he consumed strawberries during this time.. Michael Coren notes
column3: "For dessert he liked a trifle or
column5: strawberries with lots of cream."Michael Coren
column6: J.R.R. Tolkien: The Man Who Created the Lord of the Rings

column1: In J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist and Illustrator
column2: No. 23 contains an illustration by J.R.R. Tolkien of a strawberry.
